page.title: 10Local History in S.Bradford.
page.content: South Bradford is situated on rocks formed in the{Upper Carboniferous } Period.These rocks are mainly {sandstones and shales}but between these layers are seams of{coal}and deposits of{ironstone.}Therefore our region has a long history of mining. There were at least iron pits in our region providing{iron ore}for works at Bowling,Birkenshaw and Low Moor.Coal was also mined and used at the iron works.The last coal mine closed in the 1950's,this was Toftshaw Moor Colliery.As a result of many years of mining the area is littered with uncharted mines and before the new Ryan Middle School could be built over 1000 drillings had to be made and filled with concrete to ensure there were no mines under the foundations.
